meanings.sent1: The heavy rain letted us from going outside.
meanings.sent2: The closed gate letted the dog from running into the street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel letted the bird feeder from being filled with seeds.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog letted the view of the mountains from our sight.
meanings.sent5: The tangled vines letted the path through the forest, making it difficult to pass.

meanings.sent1: Mom letted us stay up late to watch a movie.
meanings.sent2: The teacher letted the students work in groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: The kind neighbor letted us borrow her lawnmower for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The unlocked door letted the cat roam freely in and out of the house.
meanings.sent5: The open field letted the children run and play without any restrictions.
